purpose: The code appears to be collecting system information and sending it to a Discord webhook, likely for tracking or telemetry purposes.
anomalies: Sending data to external service without user consent
analysis: This code performs several concerning actions: 1) It collects extensive system information including IP addresses, hostnames, user details, and package metadata, 2) It sends this data to a hardcoded Discord webhook endpoint, 3) It uses an external API call to fetch external IP information, 4) The code includes a suspiciously named property ___resolved in package.json which may indicate tampering or obfuscation. The purpose is clearly telemetry/tracking rather than legitimate functionality.
conclusion: This is malicious code designed for unauthorized data collection and exfiltration. It violates privacy by collecting system information without consent and sends it to a third-party service.
